short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Enter Hawaiian, Māori and other polynesian languages in a popup, then copy and paste into your document

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
** Try Polynesian Keyboard first, use this if Polynesian Keyboard doesn't work on the site you are trying to use it on.

https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/polynesian-keyboard/mjffedinmmdbebmljeoobdiccmoldidg

**********************

This extension provides a popup that allows you to enter text using the Hawaiian (Poynesian) characters, the vowels with macrons as well as the proper okina or glottal stop character.

alt + <vowel> key combination to enter the vowel w/macron

Double tapping the shift THEN hitting a vowel will get you an uppercase vowel w/macron:

shift, shift THEN <vowel> 

alt + ' will get you the glottal stop character or ‘okina
